crystal noun
(MINERAL)
[ C ] a piece of a substance that has become solid, with a regular shape: When sea water is allowed to evaporate, salt crystals are deposited. Cirrus clouds are composed of ice crystals.
[ C ]
  chemistry
  specialized any solid consisting of atoms or molecules that are arranged in a regular structure: Silicon crystals grown in a laboratory convert light into electrical energy.
[ C or U, C ] clear, transparent rock that is used in jewellery, or a piece of this: a pair of crystal earrings
WLADIMIR BULGAR/SCIENCE PHOTO LIBRARY/Science Photo Library/GettyImages
